Snowdon 's reaching stratton street in five weeks, also above eight views in ChesterThese could be for The journey from Chester to London or for A tour in Wales, Pennant's extra-illustrated volumes of which included numerous Chester views. See NLW, Pennant's extra-illustrated Tour in Wales, ONE, SEVEN. Elsewhere, drawings relating to Chester by Moses Griffith include 'View of Chester from Boughton [sic]' 1780 (watercolour at Grosvenor Museum, Chester); 'View of East Gate, Chester' (engraved on title page to The journey from Chester to London (1782) by P. Mazell); 'View of Chester in 1777', sculptured by W. Angus in 1811 edn. to front the title. Further on Moses Griffith and Cheshire, see 'Beeston Castle Cheshire', c.1780, pen and ink & watercolour wash at NLW; another drawing of the same at BL. The NLW drawing was engraved for The journey from Chester to London, p. 10+.

Let me congratulate you on the good news which I hope will be a strong persuasion to peace with our inveterate enemies. A reference to British victory at the Battle of the Saints, 9â€“12 April 1782. It inspirits every body as it flatters us that the scale is turning in our favor. We are rather shocked at the national ingratitude o in the recall of George Bridges Rodney, first Baron Rodney (bap.1718, d.1792), was replaced in his position as commander-in-chief in the Leeward Islands before news reached Britain of his victory at the Battle of the Saints. ODNB.
who had before done so much for us & given some lustre to our tarnished flag. An engraver sent me some political prints; but so stupid that I must send them to their proper place.
